post.description:
Trigger event is the main (and only) way to send notifications to subscribers. The trigger identifier is used to match the particular workflow associated with it. Additional information can be passed according the body interface below.
    To prevent duplicate triggers, you can optionally pass a **transactionId** in the request body. If the same **transactionId** is used again, the trigger will be ignored. The retention period depends on your billing tier.

      **type** field can be **primary** or **secondary**

429.description: The client has sent too many requests in a given amount of time.

schema.example: API rate limit exceeded

503.description: The server is currently unable to handle the request due to a temporary overload or scheduled maintenance, which will likely be alleviated after some delay.

schema.example: Please wait some time, then try again.

post.description: Update all subscriber in-app (inbox) notifications state such as read, unread, seen or unseen by **subscriberId**.

schema.example: API rate limit exceeded

503.description: The server is currently unable to handle the request due to a temporary overload or scheduled maintenance, which will likely be alleviated after some delay.

schema.example: Please wait some time, then try again.

Update subscriber's multiple in-app (inbox) notifications state such as seen, read, unseen or unread by **subscriberId**. 
      **messageId** is of type mongodbId of notifications

info.title: Novu API
info.description: Novu REST API. Please see https://docs.novu.co/api-reference for more details.

tags.name: Events
tags.description: Events represent a change in state of a subscriber. They are used to trigger workflows, and enable you to send notifications to subscribers based on their actions.

tags.name: Subscribers
tags.description: A subscriber in Novu represents someone who should receive a message. A subscriber's profile information contains important attributes about the subscriber that will be used in messages (name, email). The subscriber object can contain other key-value pairs that can be used to further personalize your messages.

tags.name: Topics
tags.description: Topics are a way to group subscribers together so that they can be notified of events at once. A topic is identified by a custom key. This can be helpful for things like sending out marketing emails or notifying users of new features. Topics can also be used to send notifications to the subscribers who have been grouped together based on their interests, location, activities and much more.

tags.name: Integrations
tags.description: With the help of the Integration Store, you can easily integrate your favorite delivery provider. During the runtime of the API, the Integrations Store is responsible for storing the configurations of all the providers.

tags.name: Workflows
tags.description: All notifications are sent via a workflow. Each workflow acts as a container for the logic and blueprint that are associated with a type of notification in your system.

tags.name: Messages
tags.description: A message in Novu represents a notification delivered to a recipient on a particular channel. Messages contain information about the request that triggered its delivery, a view of the data sent to the recipient, and a timeline of its lifecycle events. Learn more about messages.

tags.name: Environments
tags.description: Environments allow you to manage different stages of your application development lifecycle. Each environment has its own set of API keys and configurations, enabling you to separate development, staging, and production workflows.

tags.name: Layouts
tags.description: Layouts are reusable wrappers for your email notifications.

tags.name: Translations
tags.description: Used to localize your notifications to different languages.

secretKey.name: Authorization
secretKey.description: API key authentication. Allowed headers-- "Authorization: ApiKey <api_key>".

statusCode.description: HTTP status code of the error response.

timestamp.description: Timestamp of when the error occurred.

path.description: The path where the error occurred.

ctx.description: Optional context object for additional error details.

errorId.description:
Optional unique identifier for the error, useful for tracking using Sentry and 
      New Relic, only available for 500.

timestamp.description: Timestamp of when the error occurred.

path.description: The path where the error occurred.

ctx.description: Optional context object for additional error details.

Optional unique identifier for the error, useful for tracking using Sentry and 
      New Relic, only available for 500.

errors.description: A record of validation errors keyed by field name

messages: Must be a valid email address
Must be at least 18 years old

hash.description: Hashed representation of the API key

_organizationId.description: Organization ID associated with the environment

apiKeys.description: List of API keys associated with the environment

parentId.description: MongoDB ObjectId of the parent environment (optional)

color.description: Hex color code for the environment

value.description: The actual value that failed validation

schemaPath.description: JSON Schema path where the validation failed

timestamp.description: Timestamp of when the error occurred.

path.description: The path where the error occurred.

ctx.description: Optional context object for additional error details.

Optional unique identifier for the error, useful for tracking using Sentry and 
      New Relic, only available for 500.

type.description: Type identifier for payload validation errors

schema.description: The JSON schema that was used for validation

acknowledged.description: Indicates whether the trigger was acknowledged or not

error.description: In case of an error, this field will contain the error message(s)

transactionId.description: The returned transaction ID of the trigger

webhookUrl.description: The URL for the webhook associated with the channel.

deviceTokens.description: An array of device tokens for push notifications.

providerId.description: The ID of the chat or push provider.

integrationIdentifier.description: An optional identifier for the integration.

subscriberId.description: The internal identifier you used to create this subscriber, usually correlates to the id the user in your systems

email.description: The email address of the subscriber.

firstName.description: The first name of the subscriber.

lastName.description: The last name of the subscriber.

phone.description: The phone number of the subscriber.

avatar.description: An HTTP URL to the profile image of your subscriber.

data.description: An optional payload object that can contain any properties.

channels.description: An optional array of subscriber channels.

exclude.description: Optional array of subscriber IDs to exclude from the topic trigger

providers.description: Passing the provider id and the provider specific configurations

layoutId.description: Override the or remove the layout for this specific step
Override or remove the layout for all email steps in the workflow

steps.description: This could be used to override provider specific configurations or layout at the step level

channels.description: Channel-specific overrides that apply to all steps of a particular channel type. Step-level overrides take precedence over channel-level overrides.

providers.description: Overrides the provider configuration for the entire workflow and all steps

email.description: Override the email provider specific configurations for the entire workflow

push.description: Override the push provider specific configurations for the entire workflow

sms.description: Override the sms provider specific configurations for the entire workflow

chat.description: Override the chat provider specific configurations for the entire workflow

layoutIdentifier.description: Override the layout identifier for the entire workflow

name.description: The trigger identifier of the workflow you wish to send. This identifier can be found on the workflow page.

payload.description:
The payload object is used to pass additional custom information that could be 
    used to render the workflow, or perform routing rules based on it. 
      This data will also be available when fetching the notifications feed from the API to display certain parts of the UI.

overrides.description: This could be used to override provider specific configurations

to.description: The recipients list of people who will receive the notification.

oneOf.description: Unique identifier of a subscriber in your systems
Unique identifier of a subscriber in your systems

transactionId.description:
A unique identifier for deduplication. If the same **transactionId** is sent again, 
      the trigger is ignored. Useful to prevent duplicate notifications. The retention period depends on your billing tier.

actor.description:
It is used to display the Avatar of the provided actor's subscriber id or actor object.
    If a new actor object is provided, we will create a new subscriber in our system

oneOf.description: Unique identifier of a subscriber in your systems

tenant.description:
It is used to specify a tenant context during trigger event.
    Existing tenants will be updated with the provided details.

oneOf.description: Unique identifier of a tenant in your system

name.description: The trigger identifier associated for the template you wish to send. This identifier can be found on the template page.

payload.description:
The payload object is used to pass additional information that 
    could be used to render the template, or perform routing rules based on it. 
      For In-App channel, payload data are also available in <Inbox />

overrides.description: This could be used to override provider specific configurations

transactionId.description: A unique identifier for this transaction, we will generated a UUID if not provided.

actor.description:
It is used to display the Avatar of the provided actor's subscriber id or actor object.
    If a new actor object is provided, we will create a new subscriber in our system

oneOf.description: Unique identifier of a subscriber in your systems

tenant.description:
It is used to specify a tenant context during trigger event.
    If a new tenant object is provided, we will create a new tenant.

oneOf.description: Unique identifier of a tenant in your system

_id.description: The unique identifier of the integration record in the database. This is automatically generated.

_environmentId.description: The unique identifier for the environment associated with this integration. This links to the Environment collection.

_organizationId.description: The unique identifier for the organization that owns this integration. This links to the Organization collection.

name.description: The name of the integration, which is used to identify it in the user interface.

identifier.description: A unique string identifier for the integration, often used for API calls or internal references.

providerId.description: The identifier for the provider of the integration (e.g., "mailgun", "twilio").

channel.description: The channel type for the integration, which defines how the integration communicates (e.g., email, SMS).

credentials.description: The credentials required for the integration to function, including API keys and other sensitive information.

configurations.description: The configurations required for enabling the additional configurations of the integration.

active.description: Indicates whether the integration is currently active. An active integration will process events and messages.

deleted.description: Indicates whether the integration has been marked as deleted (soft delete).

deletedAt.description: The timestamp indicating when the integration was deleted. This is set when the integration is soft deleted.

deletedBy.description: The identifier of the user who performed the deletion of this integration. Useful for audit trails.

primary.description: Indicates whether this integration is marked as primary. A primary integration is often the default choice for processing.

conditions.description: An array of conditions associated with the integration that may influence its behavior or processing logic.

message.description: Optional message describing the result or any errors that occurred

skip.description: JSONLogic filter conditions for conditionally skipping the step execution. Supports complex logical operations with AND, OR, and comparison operators. See https://jsonlogic.com/ for full typing reference.

variables.description: JSON Schema for variables, follows the JSON Schema standard

skip.description: JSONLogic filter conditions for conditionally skipping the step execution. Supports complex logical operations with AND, OR, and comparison operators. See https://jsonlogic.com/ for full typing reference.

type.description: Type of the delay. Currently only 'regular' is supported by the schema.

unit.description: Unit of time for the delay amount.

cron.description: Cron expression for the delay. Min length 1.

controls.description: Controls metadata for the delay step

controlValues.description: Control values for the delay step

variables.description: JSON Schema for variables, follows the JSON Schema standard

amount.description: Amount of time for the look-back window.

unit.description: Unit of time for the look-back window.

skip.description: JSONLogic filter conditions for conditionally skipping the step execution. Supports complex logical operations with AND, OR, and comparison operators. See https://jsonlogic.com/ for full typing reference.

type.description: The type of digest strategy. Determines which fields are applicable.

amount.description: The amount of time for the digest interval (for REGULAR type). Min 1.

unit.description: The unit of time for the digest interval (for REGULAR type).

lookBackWindow.description: Configuration for look-back window (for REGULAR type).

cron.description: Cron expression for TIMED digest. Min length 1.

digestKey.description: Specify a custom key for digesting events instead of the default event key.

controls.description: Controls metadata for the digest step

controlValues.description: Control values for the digest step

variables.description: JSON Schema for variables, follows the JSON Schema standard

skip.description: JSONLogic filter conditions for conditionally skipping the step execution. Supports complex logical operations with AND, OR, and comparison operators. See https://jsonlogic.com/ for full typing reference.

amount.description: The amount of time for the throttle window (required for fixed type).

unit.description: The unit of time for the throttle window (required for fixed type).

dynamicKey.description: Key path to retrieve dynamic window value (required for dynamic type).

threshold.description: The maximum number of executions allowed within the window. Defaults to 1.

throttleKey.description: Optional key for grouping throttle rules. If not provided, defaults to workflow and subscriber combination.

controls.description: Controls metadata for the throttle step

controlValues.description: Control values for the throttle step

variables.description: JSON Schema for variables, follows the JSON Schema standard

custom.description: Custom control values for the step.

values.description: Control values specific to Custom step

controls.description: Controls metadata for the custom step

controlValues.description: Control values for the custom step

variables.description: JSON Schema for variables, follows the JSON Schema standard

url.description: URL for redirection. Must be a valid URL or start with / or {{ variable }}.

skip.description: JSONLogic filter conditions for conditionally skipping the step execution. Supports complex logical operations with AND, OR, and comparison operators. See https://jsonlogic.com/ for full typing reference.

body.description: Content/body of the in-app message. Required if subject is empty.

subject.description: Subject/title of the in-app message. Required if body is empty.

avatar.description: URL for an avatar image. Must be a valid URL or start with / or {{ variable }}.

redirect.description: Redirection URL configuration for the main content click (if no actions defined/clicked)..

data.description: Additional data payload for the step.

controls.description: Controls metadata for the in-app step

controlValues.description: Control values for the in-app step

variables.description: JSON Schema for variables, follows the JSON Schema standard

enabled.description: A flag specifying if notification delivery is enabled for the workflow. If true, notification delivery is enabled by default for all channels. This setting can be overridden by the channel preferences.

readOnly.description: A flag specifying if the preference is read-only. If true, the preference cannot be changed by the Subscriber.

enabled.description: A flag specifying if notification delivery is enabled for the channel. If true, notification delivery is enabled.

all.description: A preference for the workflow. The values specified here will be used if no preference is specified for a channel.

validatePayload.description: Enable or disable payload schema validation

payloadSchema.description: The payload JSON Schema for the workflow

isTranslationEnabled.description: Enable or disable translations for this workflow

updatedBy.description: User who last updated the workflow

lastPublishedAt.description: Timestamp of the last workflow publication

lastPublishedBy.description: User who last published the workflow

issues.description: Runtime issues for workflow creation and update

lastTriggeredAt.description: Timestamp of the last workflow trigger

resourceId.description: The resource ID to associate localizations with. Accepts identifier or slug format

resourceType.description: The resource type to associate localizations with

failedUploads.description: Number of files that failed to upload

errors.description: List of error messages for failed uploads

resourceId.description: The resource ID to associate translation with. Accepts identifier or slug format

resourceType.description: The resource type to associate translation with

workflows.description: All translations for given locale organized by workflow identifier

layouts.description: All translations for given locale organized by layout identifier

locale.description: The locale for which translations are being imported

masterJson.description: Master JSON object containing all translations organized by workflow identifier

success.description: Overall success status of the import operation

message.description: Human-readable message describing the import result
message.example: Successfully imported translations for 2 resources: welcome-email, password-reset

successful.description: List of resource IDs that were successfully imported

failed.description: List of resource IDs that failed to import

locales.description: Array of available locales for this resource

outdatedLocales.description: Locales that are outdated compared to the default locale (only present when there are outdated locales)

object.description: The type of object the event relates to.

Content-Type.description: The MIME type of the response body.

RateLimit-Limit.description: The number of requests that the client is permitted to make per second. The actual maximum may differ when burst is enabled.

RateLimit-Remaining.description: The number of requests remaining until the next window.

RateLimit-Reset.description: The remaining seconds until a request of the same cost will be refreshed.

RateLimit-Policy.description: The rate limit policy that was used to evaluate the request.

Retry-After.description: The number of seconds after which the client may retry the request that was previously rejected.

Idempotency-Key.description: The idempotency key used to evaluate the request.

Idempotency-Replay.description: Whether the request was a replay of a previous request.

post.description: This webhook is triggered when a `message` event (`message.sent`) occurs. The payload contains the details of the event. Configure your webhook endpoint URL in the Novu dashboard.

200.description: Acknowledges successful receipt of the webhook. No response body is expected.
